properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Issued For Town Of Davidson
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the precautionary drinking water advisory that was issued for Town of Davidson. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Town of Davidson water system. This advisory has been extended and is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-05-02T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Davidson, 2019-04-26T11:30:13-06:00, 7D15B738-DC53-73BF-700C-7EE82FEE994E
Area: Town of Davidson
properties.Author: SK Davidson

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continues For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-04-27T09:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-04-26T09:43:35-05:00, 1EEADF8B-A7C3-C4DF-7748-0D2F95AA1485
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall today. Rain, heavy at times, will continue today and into tonight. Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 35 mm are forecast by the time the rain tapers to scattered flurries Saturday morning. Flood messaging is in effect for much of Central and Eastern Ontario. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District office. This heavy rain is associated with a Texas Low that will track across Southern Ontario today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-26T23:22:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T15:23:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4198287577.2019
Area: Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Westport - Charleston Lake, Brockville - Prescott, Gananoque - Mallorytown, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain today and Saturday. The rain will intensify tonight as it spreads eastward. Conditions will gradually improve late in the day on Saturday. 15 to 25 millimetres of rain is expected south of the St. Lawrence River as well as over the Lower St. Lawrence. Combined with the melting of the snow on the ground, the rain is forecast to accelerate the spring freshet process. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-26T23:25:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T15:26:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0337140274.2019
Area: Saint-Rémi area, Valleyfield - Beauharnois area, Hemmingford area, Huntingdon area, Sorel - Yamaska area, Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Verchères - Beloeil area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Lacolle area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area, Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area, Weedon area, Thetford Mines area, Mont-Orford - Lake Memphrémagog area, Sherbrooke area, Coaticook area, Lac-Mégantic area, Cookshire area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area, Trois-Pistoles area, Pohénégamook area, Kamouraska area, Rivière-du-Loup area, Témiscouata
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A late season snowfall of 5 to 10 cm is expected. A transition to a showery pattern will begin across central and eastern BC later today as a trough of low pressure crosses the province. Freezing levels will drop in the wake of the system on Saturday causing rain showers to switch over to snow, particularly over the high mountain passes. 5 cm of snow will fall tonight over Pine Pass where the transition from rain to snow will occur the earliest. 5 to 10 cm of snow is expected for the Yoho Park - Kootenay Park region and higher elevations of the Trans-Canada highway including Rogers Pass. Kootenay Pass and the Elk Valley are also expected to receive 5 cm of snow later Saturday. Motorists are encouraged to be prepared for winter driving conditions and consult DriveBC for road conditions before travelling. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-27T00:57:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T16:58:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0652899262.2019
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Highway 97 - Pine Pass, Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain today and on Saturday. Rain will begin over Southern Quebec this morning and intensify overnight Friday night while spreading eastward. Conditions will improve gradually late in the day on Saturday. 15 to 25 millimetres of rain are expected south of the St. Lawrence River as well as over the Lower St Lawrence. Combined with the melting snowpack, the rain is expected to accelerate the spring freshet. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-26T20:20:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T12:21:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2234489777.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: More rain is forecast for New Brunswick tonight and Saturday. A low pressure system is expected to approach New Brunswick from the west on Saturday then track into southern Quebec Saturday night. Rain will begin over western New Brunswick this evening, then spread to eastern areas overnight. Over northern New Brunswick, 15 to 20 mm of rainfall is expected tonight and Saturday. Over southwestern and central areas of the province, rainfall amounts of 25 to 45 mm are currently forecast by late Saturday afternoon. Lesser amounts are expected over southeastern areas of the province. The rain is expected to taper to scattered showers Saturday night as the low tracks into Quebec. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-26T21:52:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T13:53:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2378418889.2019

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Les Suetes winds gusting up to 100 km/h are forecast to develop Saturday afternoon and persist Saturday evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-27T05:51:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T13:52:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1348465643.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds with gusts to 80 km/h will develop Saturday afternoon before further strengthening Saturday evening with gusts to 120 km/h. Winds will diminish below warning criteria Sunday morning. ### Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-27T10:36:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T18:37:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2638983782.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system will move southeastward across BC today and into Alberta tonight. As the system passes to the south, a cool northeast wind will develop causing rain to change to snow this evening. Snowfall accumulations of 2 to 5 cm are expected with the higher amounts near the Rockies. Near 10 cm is forecast for Tumbler Ridge by early Saturday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-27T09:36:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T17:37:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2892114808.2019
Area: B.C. South Peace River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times continues. The ground, already near saturation, has little ability to absorb further rainfall. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm are forecast by the time the rain changes to snow during the overnight hours. Local amounts exceeding 50 mm are possible. Flood messaging is in effect for much of Central and Eastern Ontario. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District office. This heavy rain is associated with a Texas Low that will track across Southern Ontario today. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall amounts of 20 to 35 mm are expected. Rain will continue today and tonight before ending early Saturday morning. Flood messaging is in effect for much of Central and Eastern Ontario. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District office. Although the forecast rainfall amounts have not changed, the Special Weather Statement has been upgraded to a Rainfall Warning due to the limited ability of the ground to absorb this rainfall. Thus the rainfall warning criterion being used is 25 mm or more in 24 hours or less. This heavy rain is associated with a Texas Low that will track across Southern Ontario today. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-27T07:22:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-26T15:23:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2002928091.2019
